New Records: Cade Cunningham matched Grant Hill for the longest triple-double streak in franchise history.
Cade Cunningham’s fifth career triple-double ties Isiah Thomas for the second-most in franchise history.
Key Match Events: Cade Cunningham finished his third consecutive triple-double by scoring the winning basket with 8.5 seconds left.
Trae Young gave the Hawks their first lead of the game at 121-120 with 12.5 seconds left.
Cunningham drove and hit a hook shot in traffic to put Detroit back in front.
Cunningham blocked Onyeka Okongwu's shot as time expired.
Trae Young had 35 points and 13 assists.
The Hawks trailed by as many as 24 points in the first half but tied the game on Dyson Daniels’ floater with 3:36 to play.
Jaden Ivey’s three-point play made it 120-116 with 2:31 left.
